definition: to reduce to a liquid or plastic state by heat
examples: the thunderstorm had fused the electric mains

definition: to blend thoroughly by or as if by melting together : combine
examples: Particles are fused to form a new compound.

definition: to stitch by applying heat and pressure with or without the use of an adhesive

examples: acetate rayon tends to fuse if pressed at too high a temperature

definition: to fail because of the blowing of a fuse
to become blended or joined by or as if by melting together
examples: Dreams fuse with reality in her latest film.

definition: an electrical safety device consisting of or including a wire or strip of fusible metal that melts and interrupts the circuit when the current exceeds a particular amperage
a continuous train of a combustible substance enclosed in a cord or cable for setting off an explosive charge by transmitting fire to it
a mechanical or electrical detonating device for setting off the bursting charge of a projectile, bomb, or torpedo
